wikipedia_page.main: Sydney Widmer Seaward (27 January 1884 – 22 June 1967) was an English actor born in Blindley Heath, Godstone, Surrey, England, United Kingdom and died at age 83 in Matlock, Derbyshire, England, United Kingdom.

response: * Sydney Seaward, On Air Personality, News Anchor, Class of '74
Men Like These is a 1932 British drama film directed by Walter Summers and starring John Batten, Sydney Seaward, Syd Crossley, James Enstone and Lesley Wareing.

The Woman of His Dream is a 1921 British silent drama film directed by Harold M. Shaw and starring Mary Dibley, Alec Fraser and Sydney Seaward.BFI.org It was adapted from a short story by Ethel M. Dell.
|Men Like These || Drama || Walter Summers || John Batten, Sydney Seaward, Syd Crossley, James Enstone, Lesley Wareing

link_mentions.page: The Loves of Mary, Queen of Scots

response: A Debt of Honour is a 1922 British silent drama film directed by Maurice Elvey and starring Isobel Elsom, Clive Brook and Sydney Seaward. It is based on a short story by Ethel M. Dell.

The Yellow Claw is a 1921 British silent crime film directed by René Plaissetty and starring Sydney Seaward, Arthur M. Cullin and Harvey Braban. The film was shot partly at Cricklewood Studios and ran 68 minutes.Workman, Christopher; Howarth, Troy (2016). "Tome of Terror: Horror Films of the Silent Era". Midnight Marquee Press. p. 231.   . It was based on the 1915 novel The Yellow Claw by Sax Rohmer, in which a French detective battles a notorious master criminal named Mr. King.

Pierre of the Plains is a 1914 film based on the novel Pierre and his People by Gilbert Parker.https://books.google.com/books?id=Yyqc0Qa6b60C&pg=PA359&dq=lawrence+mcgill+colonial+pictures&hl=en&newbks=1&newbks_redir=0&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwikgPGM64LwAhUCac0KHcEjARIQ6AEwA3oECAYQAg#v=onepage&q=lawrence%20mcgill%20colonial%20pictures&f=false Edgar Selwyn adapted the novel into the play Pierre of the Plains in 1908 and it made Elsie Ferguson a Broadway star. Benjamin S. Kutler wrote the film's scenario and it stars Selwyn, The supporting cast features Dorothy Dalton, Sydney Seaward, and Lawrence B. McGill.

The Tidal Wave is a 1920 British silent drama film directed by Sinclair Hill and starring Poppy Wyndham, Sydney Seaward and Pardoe Woodman.Low p.465 It is based on a short story by Ethel M. Dell. A fisherman rescues an artist from the sea, and falls in love with her.

The Night Hawk is a 1921 British silent drama film directed by John Gliddon and starring Henri De Vries, Malvina Longfellow and Sydney Seaward. It is based on the 1909 novel The Haven by Eden Philpotts.Low p.418
In 1921 it was adapted into the British silent film The Night Hawk starring Henri de Vries and Sydney Seaward.Goble p.367
